name: {less} for [B]rackets
body:
# {less} for [B]rackets
================================================================================
an extension that adds automatic compilation of {less} files upon saving.

### Installation

{less} for [B]rackets is installed from the Brackets Extension Manager. Please restart Brackets after installing the extension.


### Compile Options

LESS compile options can be set in the first line of the edited file:

      `// out: ../dist/app.css, compress: true, strictMath: true`

_Option Commands_

    `out`

redirect the css output to a different file

    `main`

compile a different file instead of this one (ignores all other options)

    `compress`

compress the css output

    `strictMath`

require brackets around math expressions

    `sourceMap`

generate a source map

    `autoprefixer`

value is passed as browsers to the autoprefixer-plugin, use a semicolon  `;` to separate multiple character entries.  Uses [autoprefixer](https://github.com/postcss/autoprefixer/).

    `cleancss`

value is passed as compatibility to the cleancss-plugin - (not compatible with source-maps) Uses [clean-css](https://github.com/jakubpawlowicz/clean-css/).

####Untested Options
Other less compiler options might also work, but are currently untested.

See [Grunt LESS](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt-contrib-less#options) for an extensive of options.

### Project-wide Compile Options

You can tell the extension to always compile a specific set of files in a project independent of the edited file by creating a configuration file called `.brackets.json` or `compile.json` in your project's root folder:

       `{ "less": [ "path/to/file1.less", "path/to/file2.less" ] }`

All file paths must be relative to the project's root folder. To disable less-autocompile for a project, specify an empty list of files:

        `{ "less": [] }`

***

### FAQ

How can I redirect the output to a separate file?

> Add the following line to the head of your less file:
> 
>     // out: new-file.css

How can I supress compiling this less file / compile a different less file than the one being edited?

> Add a reference to the master.less file to the head of the imported less file:
> 
>     // main: master.less

How can I supress the compilation of a single less file

> Set out to null
>
>     // out: null
